name: The Martha Moxley Case Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: When did the murder of Martha Moxley occur?
The murder occurred in an exclusive neighbourhood in what state?
questions.explanation:
Connecticut.

	The well-to-do Belle Haven community is in the affluent Connecticut city of Greenwich.

Golf Club.

	A savage beating with a golf club was the cause of death.

questions.text: Michael Skakel, who was convicted in 2002 of the 1975 murder of Martha Moxley, was the nephew of which member of the Kennedy family?
questions.explanation:
Ethel Kennedy.

	Michael 's father, Rushton Skakel, who died in 2003, was Ethel Kennedy 's brother.

questions.text: The book, 'A Season in Purgatory' was based upon the Moxley murder. Who was the author?
questions.explanation:
Dominick Dunne.

	Dunne got the ball rolling. Fuhrman's book came later.

questions.text: A tutor who had recently started work for the Skakel family was investigated as a potential suspect. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Ken Littleton.

	Shipp and 'Kato' Kaelin were witnesses in the O.J. trial. Goldberg was an attorney on the ill-fated Marcia Clark team.

questions.text: The crime occurred during which holiday?
The police department that investigated the crime was handicapped by _____ .
options: Potential intimidation by the Kennedy connection
Lack of adequate manpower and equipment
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	Homicides were virtually unheard of in Greenwich. So, too, the idea of investigating such a prominent family may have been a problem for the police. And, the department was small and not blessed with all that modern technology had to offer in crimefighting techniques.

questions.text: Evidence against Michael Skakel allegedly consists of all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.correct: An overheard statement of his intent to commit the crime
options: Admitting that he had seen Martha on the night that she died
One or more confessions by Michael Skakel
A change in Michael Skakel's 'story' as to certain key points
questions.explanation:
An overheard statement of his intent to commit the crime.

	There were alleged confessions while he was in drug rehab. He also changed his story as to his activities and whereabouts on the night of the crime, although he always admitted that he had seen her on the night in question.

questions.text: A key pre-trial issue that received substantial publicity involved what issue?
questions.correct: Michael's age at the time of the crime
options: Tommy's suspect as the principal suspect
Michael's relationship with his brother, Tommy
questions.explanation:
Michael's age at the time of the crime.

	Do you try a middle-aged man as a juvenile? There are no intellectual limitations. Tommy was (and may still be) a suspect, but that does not have anything to do with the pre-trial activities.
